data.title: A Leap into the Future
data.desc: Twitter users were much more likely to tweet about core grievances shaping the present than ones shaping their future outlook. Iraqi Twitter users seem completely drained in expressing their concern on issues that are considered a top priority in the present. In total, only 21,425 tweets tackled futur),  indicating that tweeters were 163 times more likely to discuss grievances of the present compared to visions of the future). Of those, 55% discussed the various factors shaping the outlook of the Iraqi Twitter population, 40% expressed sentiment about the future of Iraq, and only 5% expressed willingness to take action to influence or shape the future of Iraq.
